<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 194, 220, 208]]<|/det|>
# MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 216, 356, 232]]<|/det|>
Paper 3 Pure Mathematics 3 (P3)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 259, 455, 303]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: Answer Booklet/Paper Graph Paper List of Formulae (MF9)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 320, 390, 337]]<|/det|>
READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 351, 828, 367]]<|/det|>
If you have been given an Answer Booklet, follow the instructions on the front cover of the Booklet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 368, 722, 384]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 384, 327, 400]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 400, 497, 416]]<|/det|>
You may use a soft pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 416, 601, 432]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, highlighters, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 447, 284, 463]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 463, 907, 494]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 494, 590, 510]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 510, 606, 526]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 540, 606, 556]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 556, 756, 572]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 572, 440, 588]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 75.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 588, 907, 619]]<|/det|>
Questions carrying smaller numbers of marks are printed earlier in the paper, and questions carrying larger numbers of marks later in the paper.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 395, 92]]<|/det|>
Solve the inequality \(|4x + 3| > |x|\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 120, 96, 139]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 120, 920, 139]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(\ln (y + 1) - \ln y = 1 + 3\ln x\). Express \(y\) in terms of \(x\), in a form not involving logarithms.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 136, 920, 155]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 183, 96, 202]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 183, 544, 201]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(\tan 2x = 5\cot x\), for \(0^\circ < x < 180^\circ\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 183, 920, 201]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 230, 96, 248]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 230, 920, 265]]<|/det|>
(i) Express \((\sqrt{3})\cos x + \sin x\) in the form \(R\cos (x - \alpha)\), where \(R > 0\) and \(0< \alpha < \frac{1}{2}\pi\), giving the exact values of \(R\) and \(\alpha\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 245, 920, 264]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 276, 297, 294]]<|/det|>
(ii) Hence show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[361, 295, 640, 345]]<|/det|>
\[\int_{\frac{1}{6}\pi}^{\frac{1}{2}\pi}\frac{1}{((\sqrt{3})\cos x + \sin x)^2}\mathrm{d}x = \frac{1}{4}\sqrt{3}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 312, 920, 331]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 384, 96, 403]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 384, 920, 418]]<|/det|>
The polynomial \(8x^{3} + ax^{2} + bx + 3\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants, is denoted by \(\mathrm{p}(x)\). It is given that \((2x + 1)\) is a factor of \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) and that when \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is divided by \((2x - 1)\) the remainder is 1.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 431, 154, 448]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 431, 374, 448]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(a\) and \(b\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 431, 920, 448]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 462, 153, 481]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 462, 833, 481]]<|/det|>
When \(a\) and \(b\) have these values, find the remainder when \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is divided by \(2x^{2} - 1\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 462, 920, 481]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 509, 96, 528]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[371, 515, 662, 662]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 686, 920, 720]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curves \(y = \mathrm{e}^{2x - 3}\) and \(y = 2\ln x\). When \(x = a\) the tangents to the curves are parallel.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 734, 153, 752]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 734, 554, 752]]<|/det|>
Show that \(a\) satisfies the equation \(a = \frac{1}{2} (3 - \ln a)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 734, 920, 752]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 765, 153, 784]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 765, 692, 784]]<|/det|>
Verify by calculation that this equation has a root between 1 and 2.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 765, 920, 784]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 797, 151, 816]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 797, 920, 831]]<|/det|>
Use the iterative formula \(a_{n + 1} = \frac{1}{2} (3 - \ln a_{n})\) to calculate \(a\) correct to 2 decimal places, showing the result of each iteration to 4 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 816, 920, 833]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
The complex number \(z\) is defined by \(z = a + \mathrm{i}b\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are real. The complex conjugate of \(z\) is denoted by \(z^{*}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 120, 156, 139]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 120, 662, 140]]<|/det|>
Show that \(|z|^{2} = zz^{*}\) and that \((z - k\mathrm{i})^{*} = z^{*} + k\mathrm{i}\), where \(k\) is real.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 121, 920, 140]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 152, 920, 188]]<|/det|>
In an Argand diagram a set of points representing complex numbers \(z\) is defined by the equation \(|z - 10\mathrm{i}| = 2|z - 4\mathrm{i}|\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 199, 153, 217]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 199, 435, 217]]<|/det|>
Show, by squaring both sides, that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[398, 225, 598, 244]]<|/det|>
\[z z^{*} - 2\mathrm{i}z^{*} + 2\mathrm{i}z - 12 = 0.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 250, 390, 269]]<|/det|>
Hence show that \(|z - 2\mathrm{i}| = 4\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 252, 920, 269]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 282, 153, 301]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 282, 482, 301]]<|/det|>
Describe the set of points geometrically.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 282, 920, 301]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 327, 97, 346]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 327, 536, 346]]<|/det|>
The variables \(x\) and \(t\) satisfy the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 355, 556, 389]]<|/det|>
\[t\frac{\mathrm{d}x}{\mathrm{d}t} = \frac{k - x^{3}}{2x^{2}},\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 395, 698, 415]]<|/det|>
for \(t > 0\), where \(k\) is a constant. When \(t = 1\), \(x = 1\) and when \(t = 4\), \(x = 2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 428, 154, 446]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 428, 920, 463]]<|/det|>
Solve the differential equation, finding the value of \(k\) and obtaining an expression for \(x\) in terms of \(t\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 444, 920, 462]]<|/det|>
<mark>[9]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 473, 153, 492]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 473, 604, 492]]<|/det|>
State what happens to the value of \(x\) as \(t\) becomes large.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 473, 920, 492]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 520, 94, 539]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[369, 529, 665, 636]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 655, 824, 675]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve \(y = \sin^{2}2x\cos x\) for \(0\leqslant x\leqslant {\frac{1}{2}}\pi\), and its maximum point \(M\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 686, 156, 704]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 686, 383, 704]]<|/det|>
Find the \(x\)-coordinate of \(M\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 687, 920, 705]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 717, 153, 735]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 717, 920, 752]]<|/det|>
Using the substitution \(u = \sin x\), find by integration the area of the shaded region bounded by the curve and the \(x\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 733, 920, 752]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 780, 104, 798]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 780, 920, 814]]<|/det|>
The line \(l\) has equation \(\mathbf{r} = \mathbf{i} + \mathbf{j} + \mathbf{k} + \lambda (a\mathbf{i} + 2\mathbf{j} + \mathbf{k})\), where \(a\) is a constant. The plane \(p\) has equation \(x + 2y + 2z = 6\). Find the value or values of \(a\) in each of the following cases.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 826, 156, 845]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 826, 440, 845]]<|/det|>
The line \(l\) is parallel to the plane \(p\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 826, 920, 845]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 857, 153, 875]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 857, 920, 892]]<|/det|>
The line \(l\) intersects the line passing through the points with position vectors \(3\mathbf{i} + 2\mathbf{j} + \mathbf{k}\) and \(\mathbf{i} + \mathbf{j} - \mathbf{k}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 895, 920, 914]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 904, 148, 922]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 904, 640, 922]]<|/det|>
The acute angle between the line \(l\) and the plane \(p\) is \(\tan^{-1}2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 905, 920, 924]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[432, 75, 564, 90]]<|/det|>
# BLANK PAGE
